div1.p: Logan describes her research on the yellow fever commission and offers to exchange photos with Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Leatha Logan to Philip Showalter Hench, February 9, 1942
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your
prompt reply to my plea of a few
days ago. What I hope to do can be
told in a few words. Some years
ago I read Mrs. Gorgas's story of the Dr.
(her husband) and his work. Of course,
you have read it too and what it
tells of the Commission and their
work.

At once I felt I should like to have
a brief biography of each member of
the Commission also of Dr. Finlay
Dr. Carter & Dr. Gorgas just to know
something of their history back of their
world in the conquest.

So I set to work writing up such
history. just between times when I
am at home- I am a nurse- not
a graduate to my regret but trained
2.
in our N. H. D. V. S. at a time when they
trained nurses. After three years not
having anyone to turn to for a nickel
I had to perforce use my training to
earn a living. For recreation and
diversion in the years I work in the
yard among my flowers in summer
& write in write in my own words articles
I read, so gathering the material I
have & compiling it on the Conquest
has been a source of recreation for years.

I received several letters from Mr.
Moran replying to questions then thru
our representative in Congress had a copy
of “Walter Reed Memorial” and other
sources so now I have brief and
I am sure very accurate biographies of
each man. I have tried to have every
date & statement correct but all as
brief as can be. Just the very pertinent
facts about each one & you could read
it all in 20 minutes I think.

I wouldn't have the money to have it
published but it had paid me well
in the interest I have had in providing
it. I appreciate what you say about the
picture of the little house. did before
writing you in fact - but thought I could
only inquire .

Should you care to exchange a picture of
the little building I can give you in return
photos of the members of the Commission one of Dr Carter &
one of Dr. Gorgas all copies of pictures published in Mrs.
Gorgas's book. I had them made by a photographer
but copies small enough to have one for each article or
biography I have written. Please let me know.

I did not know so many people were writing
on the subject of Yellow Fever. I presume they feel
as do I that it is the one great accomplishment
next to the adoption of our constitution.
div1.closer:
I am- Very Truly Miss Leatha Logan
Marion Mr. Kissingers
house is at Huntington Ind.
R T our next County mat.
# Indiana
1505-New Nelson Street
